page.title: 05HEALTH
page.content: Before the rapid expansion of Alness the Doctor's surgery consisted of a converted house,but as the population of the town increased so did the need for a larger surgery.To relieve the problem The Robertson Health Centre was opened in 1978.The centre has seven general practitioners,one trainee doctor,two nurses and two health visitors.Every week the surgery holds a pre-natal clinic.Maternity facilities are available in Dingwall and Inverness. A dental surgery is included in the building where there is one dentist who treats a large number of patients. Outwith the Health Centre there is another dentist in the High Street situated beside an Opticians. For animal health in the area, there is a vet in the High Street as well.
